page.title: 08FARMING IN THE DRONE VALLEY
page.content: The soil in this area varies from heavy clay to light loam. Some fields are considerably wet because of subsidence from old coal mines. Most of these wet fields are used for grassland. Other fields are used for growing crops that include cereals, oil seed rape, potatoes and swede. The grasslands support dairy cows, beef cattle, sheep and pigs. Poultry and pigs are often kept in sheds for intensive farming. Many of the fields retain their old hedge boundaries but some enlarging for crops has occurred.
